# dewey

> Documentation toolkit for AI-agent-ready docs

Use `/dewey` to apply these patterns when writing or reviewing documentation.

## What it does

- Generates AGENTS.md, llms.txt, docs.json, install.md
- 22 React components for docs sites
- Skills for reviewing and improving docs
- Validates docs against source code

## Installation

pnpm add @arach/dewey

## CLI

dewey init      - Create docs/ folder and config
dewey audit     - Check completeness
dewey generate  - Create agent-ready files
dewey agent     - Score agent-readiness (0-100)

## Key Concepts

1. Agent Content Pattern
   - Each page has human (.md) and agent (.agent.md) versions
   - Agent versions: dense, structured, self-contained
   - Prefer structured data over prose for agent content

2. Skills System
   - Skills are LLM prompts, not code
   - Built-in: docsReviewAgent, promptSlideoutGenerator, installMdGenerator

3. install.md Standard
   - Follows installmd.org specification
   - LLM-executable: `curl url/install.md | claude`

## Documentation

- Overview: /docs/overview
- Quickstart: /docs/quickstart
- Components: /docs/components
- Configuration: /docs/configuration
